answerText: Willa Sibert Cather[10] This novel by Cather chronicles Thea Kronborg's rise to stardom as an opera singer after leaving Moonstone, Colorado, culminating in her triumph at the Metropolitan Opera.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | MIT A + LASA B | 4 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In one novel by this author, Marian Forrester has an affair with Frank Ellinger. For 10 points each: [10] Name this American author of A Lost Lady and O Pioneers! who wrote about Jim Burden's reminiscences of the title character in My Antonia.
